description: The nature and boundaries of communities, as well as the quality of relationships within communities, are determined by theology as well as by social, political and ethnic factors. Students examine the ways in which the world's religions, particularly Christianity, have interpreted each other's significance and truth claims and considers the ethical implications of these different responses. Prerequisite: completion of BTS-T.
name: Rel Pluralsm/Communit
notes: Open to Seniors all Passes. Open to Juniors starting at Pass 3.
title: Religious Pluralism and the Nature of Community
